intro: Heliotropium submolle, commonly known as the soft hibiscus or velvetleaf, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It is characterized by its soft, hairy stems and leaves that are often covered in fine pubescence. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. Heliotropium submolle is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of light conditions.
